subject: Re: [junit] Limitations of JUnit
msgSnippet: ... You can use JUnit to test any Java code there is. As long as you can invoke the method you want to test, JUnit doesn t care what happens inside that
messageBody:
mohitkk wrote:

> Hello, I am new to JUnit and facing various problems using it. I have
> a GUI application which has around 40 modules. Can anybody tell me
> what is the maximum limit on the no. of interconnected modules on
> which i can perfom unit test.

You can use JUnit to test any Java code there is. As long as you can
invoke the method you want to test, JUnit doesn't care what happens
inside that method.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
